intro: Anthotroche truncata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Anthotroche truncata is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
